All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.7: TB/HIV. Includes exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, treatment and prevention of tuberculosis (including medication), as well as screening and referral of TB clinic clients for HIV testing and clinical care. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. The main HIV specific purpose of TBD-2 project is to create sustainable models for high-quality HIV/AIDS service provision, through the prevention and care & treatment continuum, and effectively transfer them to the Government of the Republic of Angola (GRA) and civil society organizations. Illustrative activities include the provision of technical assistance and training to improve: 1) Provider-Initiated Testing and Counseling (PITC) strategy as an effective approach to increase HIV/AIDS case finding, 2) effective navigation of HIV/AIDS care and treatment services, increasing the number of PLHIV receiving sustained antiretroviral therapy and subsequently having viral suppression, 3) the number of new mothers effectively using adult services after delivery, 4) facility-based and community strategies to increase adherence and retention, inclusion peer-leaded activities and supporting groups, and 5) quality improvement (QI) and quality assurance (QA) methodologies to enhance patient HIV/AIDS care.
